TableField.name: EquipmentInventoryID
TableField.phrase: Record ID|An automatically assigned number used to track equipment inventory

TableField.name: EquipmentID
TableField.phrase: Equipment|An automatically assigned number used to track equipment utilized by the organization

ForeignField.name: EquipmentCategoryID
ForeignField.phrase: Equipment Category|A broadly defined title or phrase used to group similar categories of equipment

CodeField.name: EquipmentCategory
CodeField.phrase: Equipment Category|A broadly defined title or phrase used to group similar categories of equipment

ForeignField.name: EquipmentTypeID
ForeignField.phrase: Equipment Type|A method of grouping equipment of similar types so that asset protection measures can be assigned to all equipment of the same type

ForeignField.name: EquipmentType
ForeignField.phrase: Equipment Type|A method of grouping equipment of similar types so that asset protection measures can be assigned to all equipment of the same type

ForeignField.name: Equipment
ForeignField.phrase: Equipment|A description of the equipment based on a combination of field values assigned from within the equipment module
ForeignField.sample: 3M 3710 Dust Mask; Respirator; Minnesota Mining and Manufacturing; 3710

ForeignField.name: EquipmentName
ForeignField.phrase: Equipment Name|A distinct name or title used to identify the respective piece of equipment

ForeignField.name: ModelNo
ForeignField.phrase: Model Number|The model number of the equipment which is usually assigned by the equipment manufacturer

ForeignField.name: BaseUnit
ForeignField.phrase: Base Unit|The unit of measure used to normalize inventory and costs

ForeignField.name: HazardousEnergy
ForeignField.phrase: Hazardous Energy|Whether the equipment possesses hazardous energy. If the equipment is checked, the equipment will be made available within the hazardous energy module so that control procedures can be defined for the equipment

TableField.name: OrganizationID
TableField.phrase: Organization|The name of the organization where the equipment is located

ForeignField.name: Organization
ForeignField.phrase: Organization|The name of the organization where the equipment is located

RemoteField.name: LocationID
RemoteField.phrase: Location|A description of the specific location within the facility where the equipment is located. Specific locations are based on a combination of field values assigned from within the Organizations - Locations module

ForeignField.name: Location
ForeignField.phrase: Location|A description of the specific location within the facility where the equipment is located. Specific locations are based on a combination of field values assigned from within the Organizations - Locations module
ForeignField.sample: Cold Storage Receiving Area; Packing House Number 3; Cold Storage No. 6; 006

RemoteField.name: PersonAccountableID
RemoteField.phrase: Person Accountable|The individual assigned primary accountability for managing the equipment at this specific location

ForeignField.name: PersonAccountable
ForeignField.phrase: Person Accountable|The individual assigned primary accountability for managing the equipment at this specific location

TableField.name: TrackingNumber
TableField.phrase: Tracking Number|A unique number used by the organization to track specific items of equipment

TableField.name: EquipmentStorageMethodID
TableField.phrase: Storage Method|The specific method used to store the equipment on site

CodeField.name: EquipmentStorageMethod
CodeField.phrase: Storage Method|The specific method used to store the equipment on site

TableField.name: ReOrderQuantity
TableField.phrase: Reorder Quantity|The inventory quantity at which the equipment should be ordered to replentish the inventory at this specific location

TableField.name: ReOrderQuantityUoMID
TableField.phrase: Base Unit|The unit of measure used to normalize inventory and costs

ForeignField.name: ReOrderQuantityUoM
ForeignField.phrase: Base Unit|The unit of measure used to normalize inventory and costs

TableField.name: StartQuantity
TableField.phrase: Start Quantity|The quantity of equipment at this location when tracking begins

TableField.name: StartQuantityUoMID
TableField.phrase: Base Unit|The unit of measure used to normalize inventory and costs

ForeignField.name: StartQuantityUoM
ForeignField.phrase: Base Unit|The unit of measure used to normalize inventory and costs

TableField.name: StartDate
TableField.phrase: Start Date|The date the start quantity was entered

TableField.name: Issued
TableField.phrase: Issued|The number of items issued or checked out from this specific location

TableField.name: IssuedUoMID
TableField.phrase: Base Unit|The unit of measure used to normalize inventory and costs

ForeignField.name: IssuedUoM
ForeignField.phrase: Base Unit|The unit of measure used to normalize inventory and costs

TableField.name: Returned
TableField.phrase: Returned|The number of items returned or checked in to iventory at this specific location

TableField.name: ReturnedUoMID
TableField.phrase: Base Unit|The unit of measure used to normalize inventory and costs

ForeignField.name: ReturnedUoM
ForeignField.phrase: Base Unit|The unit of measure used to normalize inventory and costs

TableField.name: Added
TableField.phrase: Added|New items of this equipment added to the inventory at this specific location

TableField.name: AddedUoMID
TableField.phrase: Base Unit|The unit of measure used to normalize inventory and costs

ForeignField.name: AddedUoM
ForeignField.phrase: Base Unit|The unit of measure used to normalize inventory and costs

TableField.name: Transferred
TableField.phrase: Transferred|Items of this equipment which were transferred to another location

TableField.name: TransferredUoMID
TableField.phrase: Base Unit|The unit of measure used to normalize inventory and costs

ForeignField.name: TransferredUoM
ForeignField.phrase: Base Unit|The unit of measure used to normalize inventory and costs

TableField.name: PresentQuantity
TableField.phrase: Present Quantity|The present quantity of equipment at this location. The present quantity is based on a manual count of items in inventory at this specific location

TableField.name: PresentQuantityUoMID
TableField.phrase: Base Unit|The unit of measure used to normalize inventory and costs

ForeignField.name: PresentQuantityUoM
ForeignField.phrase: Base Unit|The unit of measure used to normalize inventory and costs

TableField.name: PresentQuantityDate
TableField.phrase: Present Quantity Date|An automatically recorded date when the present quantity was appended

RemoteField.name: PresentQuantityPersonID
RemoteField.phrase: Present Quantity Person|The individual determining and recording the present quantity

ForeignField.name: PresentQuantityPerson
ForeignField.phrase: Present Quantity Person|The individual determining and recording the present quantity

TableField.name: BeginningCalculationDate
TableField.phrase: Beginning Calculation Date|The beginning date used for calculating pertinent indicators and losses between the beginning calculation date and ending calculation Date

TableField.name: EndingCalculationDate
TableField.phrase: Ending Calculation Date|The ending date used for calculating pertinent indicators and losses between the beginning calculation date and ending calculation Date

TableField.name: LossQuantity
TableField.phrase: Loss Quantity|The quantity of equipment which cannot be accounted for but is unavailable. Lost equipment is any equipment which cannot be accounted for by equipment which was issued and not returned

TableField.name: LossQuantityUoMID
TableField.phrase: Base Unit|The unit of measure used to normalize inventory and costs

ForeignField.name: LossQuantityUoM
ForeignField.phrase: Base Unit|The unit of measure used to normalize inventory and costs

TableField.name: LossCost
TableField.phrase: Loss Cost|The financial cost of losses associated with this equipment at this specific location as of the Calculation Date

CombinedField.name: RecordLabel
CombinedField.phrase: Record Label|The short, concise, label of the record for display purposes

CombinedField.name: PresentInventoryQuantity
CombinedField.phrase: Present Quantity|A combined field used to describe the present equipment inventory quantity when associating it with other records
CombinedField.sample: 3M 3710 Dust Mask; Respirator; Minnesota Mining and Manufacturing; 3710

CombinedField.name: EquipmentInventory
CombinedField.phrase: Equipment|A combined field used to describe this equipment inventory item when associating it with other records
CombinedField.sample: 3M 3710 Dust Mask; Respirator; Minnesota Mining and Manufacturing; 3710

SampleItem.name: 3M 3710 Dust Mask; Respirator; Minnesota Mining and Manufacturing; 3710
3M 1320 SCBA; Self Contained Breating Apparatus; Minnesota Mining and Manufacturing; 3710
3M 1301 APR; Air Purifying Respirator; Minnesota Mining and Manufacturing; 3710
Cold Storage Receiving Area; Packing House Number 3; Cold Storage No. 6; 006

ViewScreen.name: View
ViewScreen.phrase: View|View summary information about an equipment inventory item

EditScreen.name: Form
EditScreen.phrase: Form|Edit summary information about an equipment inventory item

SampleItem.name: Cold Storage Receiving Area; Packing House Number 3; Cold Storage No. 6; 006

EditScreen.name: Levels
EditScreen.phrase: Levels|Edit summary information about the levels of an equipment inventory item

EditScreen.name: AssetProtection
EditScreen.phrase: Audits|Associate an equipment inventory item with asset protection methods and criteria

EditScreen.name: CostExposures
EditScreen.phrase: Cost Exposures|Associate cost exposures with the equipment inventory item

EditScreen.name: Accountability
EditScreen.phrase: Accountability|Associate participants with ongoing accountabilities for the equipment inventory item

EditScreen.name: Involvement
EditScreen.phrase: Involvement|Associate participants involved with the equipment inventory item

EditScreen.name: FileRetention
EditScreen.phrase: Files|Associate file retention methods with a physical inventory item file

EditScreen.name: BestPractices
EditScreen.phrase: Best Practices|Associate best practices with an equipment item in inventory

ViewField.sample: Cold Storage Receiving Area; Packing House Number 3; Cold Storage No. 6; 006

DocumentationSection.title: Introduction
DocumentationSection.p: The installation-specific introduction to the scope and purpose of this module should be entered here. You can click the online documentation link beneath the table of contents to see what the active agenda community has said to introduce this module. You are welcome to collect the thoughts of the community, copy them into your local documentation, and extend them to satisfy your local needs.

DocumentationSection.title: Implementation
DocumentationSection.p: Installation-specific implementation rules, policies, practices should be entered here. You can click the online documentation link beneath the table of contents to see what the active agenda community has said about implementating this module. You are welcome to collect the thoughts of the community, copy them into your local documentation, and extend them to satisfy your local needs.

DocumentationSection.p: Installation-specific information regarding the way this module impacts people should be entered here. You can click the online documentation link beneath the table of contents to see what the active agenda community has said about how this module impacts, or is impacted by, people in general. You are welcome to collect the thoughts of the community, copy them into your local documentation, and extend them to satisfy your local needs.
